instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage
threads.message: This board came in with liquid damage around the ISL and TPS chips. After repairing the obvious liquid damage the computer got a green light, fan spin, and three beeps. I noticed this capacitor had exploded and part of it was up under the edge of another RAM module. My board view for 00138 seems to be a 3662 does anyone have any idea what the values of the little white capacitors just above the RAM under the CPU I have attached a picture of where the component used to be.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage
threads.message: I doubt that cap will cause issues. Check on which rail it is, if it is just parallel with all the other caps it will work with anything there. More likely is corrosion under the RAM/CPU
